wiki.summary: Originally, “better off” wasn’t supposed to be on "Sweetener", but Ariana changed her mind and decided to add more songs to the album. Ariana revealed on Twitter that “better off” was the first song she added back to the album tracklist. She further reiterated this on an interview with Zach Sang that she wasn’t going to originally put it on the album in fear of its honesty of the relationship at the time and its potential to go south. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: Originally, “better off” wasn’t supposed to be on "Sweetener", but Ariana changed her mind and decided to add more songs to the album. Ariana revealed on Twitter that “better off” was the first song she added back to the album tracklist. She further reiterated this on an interview with Zach Sang that she wasn’t going to originally put it on the album in fear of its honesty of the relationship at the time and its potential to go south. The song finds Ariana realizing that a relationship isn’t for her and that she’s “better off without him” as she’d “rather [his] body than half of [his] heart”. Hence, to “steer clear of any headaches to start”, she “dismisses” his propositions. It has been speculated the track is about Ariana’s former boyfriend, Mac Miller, a relationship with whom she’s previously denounced as “toxic” and the editor’s notes for the album on Apple Music express similar sentiments saying “ she exits a toxic relationship in “better off”. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
